1.text: Fill a large bowl with 1–2 inches (2.5–5.1 cm) of water.

2.text: Place the radishes in the water for up to 3 days.

3.text: Put the bowl in the refrigerator for 5-8 days.

4.text: Cut the leafy tops and roots off of the radishes.

5.text: Place the radishes in a plastic bag layered in dampened paper towels.

6.text: Seal the bag and remove excess air.

7.text: Store the bag of radishes in the refrigerator for 1-2 weeks.

8.text: Wash the radishes and trim their roots and tops.

9.text: Put the radishes in a canning jar.

10.text: Fill the jar with water and place it in the refrigerator for up to 8 days.

11.text: Fill a box with damp sand and place it in your basement or cellar.

12.text: Place unwashed radishes in the box of sand.

13.text: Store the radishes in the sand for up to 3 months.

14.text: Check the radishes for rotting once a week.
